sentence.Network_en: Striker Alan Smith was guilty of two glaring misses.
sentence.Network_cn: 前锋艾伦·史密斯两次严重失误，将球射偏。

sentence.Network_en: I never saw such a glaring example of misrepresentation.
sentence.Network_cn: 我从未见过像这样明目张胆地歪曲事实。

sentence.Network_en: At the examination he made several glaring blunders, and that did for him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在考试中出了几个大错, 这下就完了.

...指某种装置可用以反射、或散射光源所发出之光线，通常主要可藉由漫射完成23˙直接眩光（direct glare）视野内由于极高亮度或因光源遮蔽不足、或因高亮度反射所引起之眩光.

entry.def: If you describe something bad as glaring, you are emphasizing that it is very obvious and easily seen or noticed.

example.ex: I never saw such a glaring example of misrepresentation.
example.tran: 我从未见过像这样明目张胆地歪曲事实。

means.word_mean: 2. conspicuously and outrageously bad or reprehensible;

auth_sentence.content: You are the one with glaring errors in logic.
auth_sentence.res_content: You are the one with glaring errors in logic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You are the one with glaring errors in logic.

auth_sentence.content: They sat in silence, glaring at each other.
auth_sentence.res_content: They sat in silence, glaring at each other.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They sat in silence, glaring at each other.

auth_sentence.content: Sir Thomas...commits glaring transgressions against his own moral principles.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sir Thomas...commits glaring transgressions against his own moral principles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sir Thomas...commits glaring transgressions against his own moral principles.

sentences.en: the glaring light of high noon
The report contained some glaring errors.
At the examination he made several glaring blunders,and that did for him.
sentences.cn: 他在考试中出了几个大错,这下就完了。
